title: Joel Matip pens new long-term contract at Liverpool until the summer of 2024
text:
Joel Matip has penned a new five-year contract at Liverpool - which ensures the in-form defender will remain at Anfield until the summer of 2024.

The 28-year-old has impressed alongside Virgil van Dijk this season for the reigning European champions, and has made 107 appearances for the club since joining on a free transfer from Schalke in 2016.

Liverpool confirmed the news on Friday afternoon after Matip had agreed to fresh terms at Melwood, with his initial deal set to expire at the end of the campaign.

Joel Matip has signed a new long-term contract at Liverpool until the summer of 2024

The 28-year-old defender has impressed alongside Virgil van Dijk for the club this season

In a statement on Liverpool's website, the centre half said: 'It's a great feeling to be a longer part of the club. It's really just a great feeling.

'From outside, you know Liverpool is such a big club – but when you are inside, then you really get a feeling for how big the club is. In all the countries, the supporters are everywhere. It's a massive and big club that I think every player would want to play for.'

'We have a young and talented team and I think every one of us is hungry. Now we've seen how it is to win something and we want to have that feeling again.

'There are a lot of things still to achieve. You never know how it will end, you just have to work hard and do the best you can do. Then we will see.

The German-born star had agreed to pen fresh terms at Melwood on Friday afternoon

Matip had made 194 appearances in the Bundesliga before sealing a switch to England

'It is an honour to be a part of the club. It makes me happy that people think I've done a good job and they want to keep me.'

Matip had progressed through Schalke's youth ranks before switching to England, and boasts 194 senior appearances for the German outfit in the Bundesliga.

The defender had also played a crucial role in Liverpool's Champions League triumph last term, having laid on an assist for Divock Origi's crucial goal, and is set to return to action in Sunday's clash against Manchester United.

The top flight giants have also tied down Mohamed Salah, Roberto Firmino, Sadio Mane, Andy Robertson and Trent Alexander-Arnold to new deals within the past 18 months.
